setOptions

public void setOptions(java.lang.String[] options)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Parses a given list of options controlling the behaviour of this object. Valid options are:

-f "input file name"
Specifies name of the input file.

-s "input scoring function"
Specifies name of the scoring function.

-d
Turns debugging mode on.

Parameters:
options - the list of options as an array of strings
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if an option is not supported

loadStopWordList

public void loadStopWordList(java.lang.String fname)

loadFile

public void loadFile()
LoadFile: loads the file for which the lexical chains will be built Stores file in the Active Significant Word List. Stop words and punctuation are removed at this stage. The format of the file must be one sentence per line as the lexical chain building algorithm requires that the line number of a sentence be known. candiWL contains the same words as ASWL without repetitions Sept 12: candiWL is not rquired anymore. Left in code for compatibility reasons. Same goes for uniqWL allHeadSet and wsdHeadSet are required wsdHeadSet represents all of the Heads that are used more than once in the text, i.e. the disambiguated meanings
